$subject.

Approach
Methods performing qualifier based directions are given self qualifier parsing abilities thus allowing them to make decisions without taking qualifiers into account. Further, those methods are generalized so that It doesn't matter whether qualifiers are already passed in a previous stage and come.

parseObjectMemberWithoutMeta
parseObjectMethodOrField

commit.message:
Revamp BallerinaParser qualifier parsing

Give methods performing qualifier based directions, self qualifier parsing capabilities thus allowing them to direct without worrying about the qualifiers.
Address added TODOs from the previous commit
Resolve readonly and distinct keyword parsing ambiguity

nodes.bodyText: Any reason for removing these test cases?
Its fine to call this parseModuleVarDecl. The overloaded parameters will indicate this takes qualifiers from outside..
Inverting the condition would be better

What if we move this, entirely before the switch-case, and only call parseTypeDescQualifiers(qualifiers);, (without the if-check and without the re-parse)?
inside parseTypeDescQualifiers(qualifiers) we can have a while loop, rather than the do-while.
Can do the same for top-level nodes as well
Invert the condition. Let's do the early exit in all places
Better to extract this logic inside the 'if-condition' to a separate method, something like isValidMethodQualifier
